content.en: Dengue outbreak forecasting: Scientists have been using machine learning algorithms to improve forecasting techniques for dengue outbreaks. These algorithms, such as LASSO-derived models, compound variables and lag times, generalized additive models (GAMs), hierarchical spatial Bayesian models, ensemble penalized regression algorithms (EPRA), random forest, AdaBoost, extra-trees, regularized regressions, artificial neural networks (ANN), Bayes network models, support vector machine (SVM), RBF tree, decision table, naive Bayes, regression and time series models, and machine learning techniques, have been effective in predicting dengue cases and outbreaks in different regions around the world. By analyzing historical records, climate data, social media surveillance, and other external data, these algorithms can accurately forecast dengue risk and help public health officials take proactive measures to prevent outbreaks.
content.da: Forudsigelse af dengueudbrud: Forskere har brugt maskinlæringsalgoritmer til at forbedre forudsigelsesteknikkerne for dengueudbrud. Disse algoritmer, såsom LASSO-afledte modeller, sammensatte variable og forsinkelsestider, generaliserede additive modeller (GAM'er), hierarkiske rumlige Bayesian modeller, ensemble-penaliserede regressionsalgoritmer (EPRA), random forest, AdaBoost, ekstra-træer, regulerede regressioner, kunstige neurale netværk (ANN), Bayes netværksmodeller, support vector machine (SVM), RBF-træ, beslutningstabel, naive Bayes, regressions- og tidsseriemodeller og maskinlæringsteknikker, har været effektive til at forudsige denguetilfælde og udbrud i forskellige regioner rundt om i verden. Ved at analysere historiske optegnelser, klimadata, sociale medieovervågninger og andre eksterne data kan disse algoritmer nøjagtigt forudsige dengue risiko og hjælpe sundhedsmyndigheder med at tage proaktive foranstaltninger for at forhindre udbrud.
